alert.note: Alert for Juab; Millard; Tooele; Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 24 at 11:59AM MDT until March 24 at 12:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Millard County in central Utah... Eastern Juab County in central Utah... Southwestern Utah County in northern Utah... Southeastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 1230 PM MDT * At 1158 AM MDT, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Pleasant Grove to 8 miles east of Delta, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 185 and 273. US Route 6 between mile markers 97 and 177. US Route 50 between mile markers 94 and 95, and between mile markers 130 and 134. Locations impacted include... Provo, Payson, Nephi, Scipio, Orem, Spanish Fork, Springville, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Santaquin, Mapleton, Salem, Elk Ridge, Woodland Hills, Rocky Ridge, Cedar Fort, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Palmyra and Lake Shore. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
